intro: Dianthus hirtus subsp. graniticus, commonly known as the granitic campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its pink or red flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It is a perennial species that produces small, clustered flowers in early summer. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, arid conditions.
